messages.text:
A father cries over his little daughter who is suffering from dehydration and malnutrition in the north of Gaza.

شاب من شمال غزة يبكي طفلته المُعرضة للموت بسبب الجوع ونقص التغذية.

A number of Palestinian children were injured after the bombing of a home in the north of Nusairat refugee camp.

اصابة عدد من الأطفال في قصف منزل شمال مخيم النصيرات

A number of Palestinian children were injured after the bombing of a home in the north of Nusairat refugee camp.

اصابة عدد من الأطفال في قصف منزل شمال مخيم النصيرات

Funded by US taxpayers, children are burned alive in Gaza by the bombardment of the Israeli occupation forces. This child arrived just two hours ago at the Baptist (Al-Ahli Al-Arab) Hospital at the north of Gaza.
Assaulting the bodies of Palestinian civilians after they were killed while trying to return to their homes in the northern Gaza Strip.

Joury Al-Areer is a child suffering from cancer and severe malnutrition in North Gaza. Joury weighs only 8 kilos, down from a previous 15 kilos, despite being 5 years old. The famine and malnutrition crisis exacerbated by the ongoing siege has left her body frail and weak. In a heartbreaking appeal, Joury expresses her wish to travel and receive treatment, to gain weight, and to get better. Her story is just one representation of the suffering faced by many children in the northern Gaza Strip.

Three Palestinian young men were executed by the Israeli occupation forces in Qalqilia city. 

من مكان عملية اغتيال 3 فلسطينيين على يد قوات خاصة “إسرائيلية” وسط مدينة قلقيلية

Israeli special force executes a number of Palestinians in Qalqilia city. 

قوة خاصة اسرائيلية تغتال عدد من الشبان في قلقيلية

Dr. Raed Al-Areeny, a thoracic surgeon, highlights the catastrophic health situation in Gaza during a life-saving surgery, citing severe shortages of medical supplies and the unavailability of essential bleeding control materials.

خلال عملية جراحية لإنقاذ أحد المصابين.. جراح الصدر الدكتور رائد العريني يشرح الوضع الصحي الكارثي بسبب نقص المواد الطبية في قطاع غزة وعدم توفر مستلزمات وقف النزيف

Bader Dahlan, 29, is a recently released detainee who spent only a month in an Israeli prison but experienced significant horrors. Bader recounts the severe torture he endured, including electrocution and brutal beatings that left him fearing for his life and at one point fearing amputation of his leg. Detained from Netzarim in Khan Yunis, he describes the prison conditions as a nightmare, detailing how he was forced to move on his hands and was repeatedly struck on his arms and legs. Bader also shares the psychological impact of his detention, expressing confusion and fear upon his release, and the uncertainty of not knowing where his family is, as he heard that Khan Yunis was destroyed. He currently stays in a hospital, feeling suffocated and overwhelmed by the trauma he experienced.
One of last night's injuries from the Baptist (Al-Ahli Al-Arab) Hospital, being treated with minimal resources amidst a lack of medical supplies and the spread of famine.
What sin?! A girl no more than 3 years old, she is injured in the head by an explosion from the occupation.

There is a resurgence of famine in both the northern and southern regions of Gaza, but especially in the north where all borders have been closed for a long time.
There are severe shortage of food and essentials, with markets barren and children unable to find medicine, food, or drink.
Even during Eid, they had no meat, fruits, or vegetables, relying solely on canned food, which is also running out.
Abboud talks about the resilience of the people, who have endured famine, war, siege, and constant threats. He speaks with pride about their ability to create something out of nothing and their deservingness to be recognized as one of the best peoples in the world.
Shells fall on the heads of Palestinian citizens in the Al-Jalaa area in central Gaza City.

Heavy Israeli artillery shelling targets Al Jala’a street in Gaza city.

قصف مدفعي عنيف على شارع الجلاء في مدينة غزة

The damage to a school after a home near to it was bombed in Khan Younis city, southern Gaza.

شاهد أضرار كبيرة في مدرسة تؤوي عدد كبير من النازحين بعد قصف منزل بمحيطها بخانيونس جنوبي قطاع غزة

A little child survived the bombing of the home belonging to the Allouh family in Nusairat refugee camp.

طفل رضيع ينجو من قصف الاحتلال على منزل لعائلة اللوح في مخيم النصيرات وسط القطاع

The moment of the bombing of a home near Naser hospital in Khan Younis city.

لحظة استهداف منزل بجوار مستشفى ناصر الطبي غرب خانيونس

A young man sitting on the beach of Gaza creates pieces of art inside glass bottles. With lots of his creations still back in his home in Gaza city, he showcases what he could do with the almost complete lack of tools and material.
The Courageous Journalist Maha al-Husseini.

When our government continues to enable the Gaza genocide, it's the responsibility of ordinary people to take direct action.
Ready to bring down the zionist war machine? Join an upcoming training day at palestineaction.org/apply
*Applications close at 12PM the day before a training day is due to take place

Children collect what remains of food amidst the famine in the north of Gaza as the aggression and blockade continue. 

المجاعة تزداد في شمال غزة مع استمرار العدوان
A freed prisoner from Khan Younis attempts to describe the conditions of the Israeli horrors in the prison.

Dina lyad Al-Rantisi, the daughter of Dr. Iyad Al-Rantisi, director of the Obstetrics and Gynaecology Hospital at the Kamal Adwan Medical Complex expresses her profound shock and grief upon learning of her father's death through a Israeli newspaper Haaretz. She had been anxiously awaiting his release for the past eight months, hoping and praying every day for good news. The sudden news of his martyrdom was devastating. She demands a clear answer from official authorities about the actual fate of her father.

"Not a single building will be left standing in Gaza"
An Israeli soldier documents the systematic demolition of Palestinian neighborhoods in the city of Rafah, captioning it with calls for the genocidal destruction of the remaining Gaza.

The Alexandroni Brigade in the Israeli occupation forces is blowing up buildings in the Nitzanim axis.
It is worth mentioning that the Alexandroni Brigade was one of six field forces of the Haganah gangs and participated in the massacre of the village of Tantura in 1948.

A little girl bids farewell to her mother who was killed by an Israeli air strike in Gaza.

“مع السلامة يما”... طفلة من قطاع غزة تودع والدتها الشهيدة

Only one month of kidnapping in Israeli torture prisons made Badr, 30 years old, a different person, suffering from severe psychological problems and difficult disorders, due to the severity of the torture, assault and abuse.
He says what he experienced was a nightmare.

A sewing needle out of a can of meat?
Gazan Qusai Jarad shows us, step by step, how Gazans are creating makeshift needles out of meat cans due to the lack of sewing needles entering the market.

Israeli occupation forces prevent an ambulance carrying a patient from passing through the entrance of Qabr Helwa, east of Bethlehem in the West Bank.
These are the Israeli army female soldiers, who if anything happens to them, their photos will be published in civilian clothes and they will be considered civilians.
"Goodbye, Mom." A girl bids farewell to her mother with touching words.

Israeli occupation forces continue to burn Palestinian homes in Rafah, which constitutes a war crime under all international laws. So far, after 258 days and thousands of videos documenting war crimes, the United States still does not see "any indications" of Israel committing any violations of international or American law.

Do you think that in the details of Gaza City, your emotions and astonishment will be limited to a certain extent? Absolutely not. In Gaza, you will keep seeing, hearing, and experiencing what you can't even imagine, with one question: "How can a people like this be defeated?"
Under Gaza's blue sky, this image shows a destroyed house turned into a temporary pharmacy. Among the rubble, the pharmacist provides medicine to those in need, embodying the resilience and solidarity of the neighborhood's residents despite the targeting of medical facilities. This image is not just a documentation of a difficult moment but a living testimony to human strength in challenging circumstances.
The will to live and cling to hope make this wreckage a beacon of hope and determination, sending a message to the world that Gaza will remain steadfast, no matter the challenges.

Satellite images show the extent of the destruction caused by the occupation in the area of ​​the Yabna and Al-Shaboura camps and the vicinity of the Al-Huda and Al-Abrar mosques - Rafah

صور الأقمار الإصطناعية تظهر حجم الدمار الذي خلفه الاحتلال في منطقة مخيمي يبنا والشابورة ومحيط مسجدي الهدى والأبرار في رفح.

The Israeli occupation forces raid Jenin city. 

قوات الاحتلال تقتحم مدينة جنين

Asdaa Amusement Park in Gaza, once a popular destination for families to celebrate Eid and enjoy rides, the park is now filled with plastic tents and clotheslines, fully transformed into a displacement center. Displaced families have taken refuge here, with children sleeping in the very rides they once played on. The park, a symbol of joy and community gatherings, now stands as a reminder of the life before the ongoing war.
At least 10 Palestinians were killed and dozens were injured by an Israeli air strike that targeted a group of civilians on Salah Eddin street, east of Rafah, southern Gaza Strip.

A Palestinian was killed and others were injured by an Israeli air strike that targeted a group of civilians in Rafah.

شهيد وعدد من الاصابات من استهداف مجموعه من المواطنين بمنطقة الشوكة برفح
Loved Ones from Everywhere.
Animals in Gaza are dying from extreme exhaustion and food shortages given the lack of fuel.

"There is nothing wrong with humiliating Palestinians"
A documentary trailer by Zeteo showcases bold interviews with Israeli journalists and former soldiers openly discussing genocidal intentions towards Palestinians.

In less than a minute this is what this teen with special needs went through during the war. He lost his house due to air strikes, he suffered from starvation and thirst.
Many attempts were made on his life and he pleads with the world that he's afraid of dying and needs this war to end, but unfortunately today he found out that his brother had been killed as the war drags on. How many lives will be lost or ruined and for how long will this continue?

Anwar Al-Ghazi publishes a great clip on his
"Stand in the right place even if it means standing alone."
"I have no regrets, and I am not afraid for my position. I will not deviate from what I said and what I stand for. I will stay until my last breath for humanity and the oppressed for the children of Gaza. I love you, and I will always stand for you."
Even GB news admits that direct action works.
The funerals of martyrs in Gaza do not stop, and the oppression, loss and pain continue.
The daily struggle of Palestinians to get water in the north of Gaza Strip.

Detainees from Gaza are subjected to the most inhumane, barbaric, and sadistic methods during interrogation in Israeli prisons. Dr. Muneer Al Barsh, the Director General of the Ministry of Health in Gaza, describes the horrific methods of torture reported by detainees, including electric shocks, suspension, stretching, and nail pulling. He then reiterates a story of the most barbaric practice, where trained dogs were used to carry out vile actions against detainees. These sadistic behaviors have been corroborated by multiple testimonies from detainees who received treatment in the hospital.

A Palestinian nurse takes care of a child who was injured along with his family in an Israeli bombing of a house in the central Gaza Strip.

ممرضة فلسطينية تعتني بطفل أصيب مع عائلته بقصف إسرائيلي لمنزل وسط قطاع غزة.

A number of Palestinians were killed after the tents of displaced Palestinians were targeted and bombed, west of Khan Younis.

عدد من الشهداء والجرحى 
الاحتلال يستهدف خياما للنازحين بشارع الشاكوش غرب مدينة خانيونس جنوبي قطاع غزة

“Please wake up dad” .. children bid farewell to their father who was killed by the occupation forces in the Nusairat refugee camp. 

“أمانة يا بابا قوم اطّلع علينا”.. من وداع أطفال الشهيد محمد محسن الذي ارتقى صباح اليوم برصاص آليات الاحتلال غرب مخيم النصيرات

A number of Palestinians were killed and others were wounded during the bombing of the home of the Abu Safiya family in Gaza city. 

انتشال الشهداء والجرحى جراء قصف الاحتلال منزلاً لعائلة أبو صفية بحي الشيخ رضوان بمدينة غزة

A number of Palestinians were killed after the bombing of the home of the Abu Safiya family in Gaza city. 

انتشال الشهداء والجرحى جراء قصف الاحتلال منزلاً لعائلة أبو صفية في الشارع الثاني بحي الشيخ رضوان بمدينة غزة
Video posted today shows an Israeli drone killing two Palestinians in Tal Al Sultan area in the west of Rafah in Gaza.

Was it an act? Footage released by the OF, which claims to show an alleged fighter from Jabalia camp being forced to drop his weapon. However, an investigation reveals the detainee is Omar Abdulraheem Mohammad Haidar, a 35-year-old civilian suffering from mental disorders.
Statements from his mother and neighbor confirm Omar's psychological issues and ongoing treatment. They assert that Omar was coerced into making statements against his will for the lOF's propaganda.
The sniper has been chasing Maryam since her birth.

The child Maha Al-Arair, 5 years old, from the Gaza Strip, her family were bombed by occupation warplanes. Maha is the only survivor. Her family, her father, her mother, and her brothers, Marah, Munir, and Muhammad, were martyred.

A newly released video shows occupation forces targeting civilians in Rafah. 

لقطات تظهر استهداف الاحتلال المدنيين في رفح
The video was published only after obtaining the parents' consent.

Heavy and continuous Israeli air strikes in the north of Gaza Strip.

غارات جوية عنيفة ومجازر مستمرة بحق المواطنين في مناطق شمال وغرب غزة

In Gaza, Eid al-Adha became the Eid of loss and longing. Despite their attempts to celebrate and be joyful during the holiday, you can see in the faces of the children the sadness of their loss and their longing for their families. Their innocent words express their yearning for their loved ones.

Eid al-Adha, which is a celebration of food and drink, joy and happiness, passes over the people of Gaza while they are starving. They cannot find a bite to feed their hungry children, a sip of water to quench the thirst of their elders, or medicine to ease the pain of their wounded. Has the conscience of humanity died as it watches this tragedy without taking any action?!!
This is how children celebrate the third day of Eid in Northern Gaza by remembering their dead fathers and mothers.

This child was injured by shrapnel
in the abdomen after a missile explosion about 20 days ago.
Things are now getting worse. The patient needs to be transferred out of Gaza immediately. He must go to a place that has all the necessary capabilities. We do not have anything to offer this child.

A Palestinian was killed after being shot by an Israeli drone at Al Sahaba market in Gaza city. 

استشهاد فلسطيني جراء استهدافه من قبل طائرة كواد كابتر “إسرائيلية” في سوق الصحابة بمدينة غزة.

“I dream to walk” .. the child Yassin Ghalban (11) lost both of his legs by a drone missile that targeted him whilst he was inspecting the rubble of his home which was destroyed during the aggression against Gaza.

الطفل ياسين الغالبان فقد ساقيه في قصف طائرة مسيرة اثناء تفقده ركام منزله المدمر في غزة

“The bodies fly, hit the wall and fall” .. a Palestinian woman tells what happened after the bombing of a home in the Nusairat refugee camp, last night.

سيدة تروي ما حصل بعد القصف الاحتلال لمنزل في مخيم النصيرات
What did Yazan do with the aid packages? An inventive story from Gaza.
Lack of clean drinking water for 95% of displaced people in Gaza threatens health crisis.

A child bids farewell to his mother who was killed after the bombing of their home in the Nusairat refugee camp, central Gaza.

 اغلى اشي عندي راح “ طفل يودع أمه الشهيدة التي ارتقت الليلة جراء استهداف منزلهم في مخيم النصيرات وسط القطاع
The elegant journalist.
Eight Palestinians were killed by an Israeli air strike that targeted traders and security personnel, east of Rafah.

Abboud Manaa gets his Eid trim as it's traditional to do so during and before Eid Al-Adha. The family of children of Gaza are doing all they can to provide their children with normalcy and a sense of joy during Eid.
"This is not the way to help us" - A farmer complains about the airdrops that partially destroyed his farm!
Mohammad is a 9 year old boy with a martyred father. He is spending Eid Al-Adha alone and wanted to deliver a message to his father.

The child Amjad Qanou’a (3) suffers dehydration and malnutrition as the aggression continues in the north of Gaza.

الطفل امجد القانوع 3 سنوات، يعاني من سوء التغذية والجفاف بمستشفى كمال عدوان شمال قطاع غزة.

The child Amjad Qanou’a (3) suffers dehydration and malnutrition as the aggression continues in the north of Gaza.

الطفل امجد القانوع 3 سنوات، يعاني من سوء التغذية والجفاف بمستشفى كمال عدوان شمال قطاع غزة.

In a series of beautiful photographs taken during Eid, children in Gaza are seen honouring tradition after their families did all they could to procure new outfits for them even during the ninth month of the ongoing genocide.

Wael Al-Namla, 27, (L) stands with his son Shareif (R) In their house in Al- Joneina neighbourhood in the east of Rafah town in the southern Gaza Strip. 

Wael Al Namla, 27, his wife Isra-a, 21, and their son Shareif three years old, the three of them lost their lower limbs together to one Israeli bomb when they were trying to find a safe place to stay.

Rafah crossing burned :Israeli soldiers torched the Palestinian crossing after using it as a military base. Two pictures showing the first day after the takeover and the burning this month.
Torched for no reason. Israel hasn't stated that they found anything.

Children struggle to get food amid the famine in the north of Gaza on the second day of Eid.

أطفال يحاولون الحصول على الطعام في ظل اشتداد المجاعة في شمال غزة
A little girl cries whilst celebrating Eid after thinking of her father who was killed during the war against Gaza.

Khan Younis : An Israeli soldier posted on social media a video taken by drone showing several Palestinian families trapped inside a house, waving their hands and surrendering to Israeli forces in Gaza.
It remains unclear if those in the video are still alive.
Does anyone know this family?
The children of Gaza, robbed of Eid celebrations by the occupation, endure hardship beyond their years, their innocence overshadowed by conflict and longing for moments of joy and peace.

BREAKING: Palestine Action lock down all entrances into Scotiabank's London office.
Despite slashing their stake in half, the bank still invest over $230million in Israel's biggest weapons firm, making them the largest foreign shareholder in Elbit Systems.
Support the ongoing action at 201 Bishopsgate, London, EC2M 3NS!
The targeting of a house in Al-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, belonging to Al-Muqat family, resulting in the martyrdom of an elderly man, child and 12 injuries.
Palestine actions actionists broke into Elbit’s Instro Precision, an Israeli weapons factory in Kent, UK. Causing the ‘highly secure’ factory extensive damage.

A pro Palestine protest was overrun with police exerting their brutality on protesters calling for an end to Israel’s genocide on Gaza in Berlin. Police violence against any pro Palestine sentiment has become increasingly suppressed in Germany over the past several months.
On the first day of Eid al-Adha, children celebrate Eid in their own way in the northern of gaza, despite death and war.
A girl cries over her dresses that were burned during the bombing of their house.
Has the world ever celebrated a holiday like this?

A number of Palestinians were killed, most of them children, by an Israeli air strike that targeted a home in the Braij refugee camp.

مجزرة العيد .. شهداء غالبيتهم من الأطفال في قصف منزل في مخيم البريج وسط القطاع

These were her Eid shoes .. Palestinians bid farewell to a little girl who was killed by an Israeli bombardment on the first day of Eid in Gaza.

طفلة ارتقائي قصف إسرائيلي اثناء احتفالها بالعيد في غزة

A little child receives medical treatment following his injury by an Israeli bombardment in the Braij refugee camp whilst celebrating Eid. 

طفل يتلقى العلاج بعد اصابته في قصف اسرائيلي اثناء احتفاله في العيد

A Palestinian bids farewell to her father who was killed by an Israeli air strike that bombed a home in the Braij refugee camp.

فلسطينية تودع والدها الذي ارتقى في قصف على مخيم البريج وسط القطاع

Palestinian children were celebrating Eid when they were killed by an Israeli bombardment in Gaza.

اطفال ارتقوا في قصف اسرائيلي في اول ايام العيد في غزة

A 9 month old little girl was killed by an Israeli bombardment on the first day of Eid in Gaza.

طفلة تبلغ من العمر ٩ شهور استشهدت في اول ايام العيد في قصف اسرائيلي في غزة

This is how our children welcome Eid al-Adha in the same way they welcomed Eid al-Fitr, or even worse
We no longer have words to say
These 9 months have destroyed us without any change in our situation
I will not congratulate you on Eid this time, as we have no Eid and our children are being killed and mutilated in front of the whole world
The world is accustomed to our situation, but we are not and will never become accustomed to this situation.

The people of Gaza welcome Eid al-Adha this year while the bloodshed caused by the Israeli occupation in the Gaza Strip continues unabated, as part of an ongoing genocidal war. What does Eid look like there?

The writing on the occasion of Eid al-Adha on the walls of the destroyed houses that the occupation demolished on their owners in northern Gaza is: (We want the Eid to be with our people who were displaced to southern Gaza, there is no Eid without our people who were displaced to. southern Gaza)

Gunfire exchange with the Israeli occupation forces that raided Al Faraa refugee camp in Tubas city. 

اشتباكات في مخيم الفارعة بطوباس عقب اقتحام قوات الاحتلال
The children of Gaza during Eid Adha, Give us childhood and peace.

As the Islamic holiday Eid al-Adha approaches, more and more people are gathering to pray in the Ibrahimi mosque. However, Israeli forces have closed the checkpoint in front of them, allowing only a few people to pass every 10 minutes. This has left dozens, including men, women, and children, waiting outside.
Many people left to pray the Friday prayer on time at another mosque, but many have stayed because they want to visit the mosque, and it's not easy to get there.
Since October 7th, the situation has worsened in the Old City of al-Khalil. Checkpoint closures occur very frequently and randomly. Hundreds of people live on the other side of the checkpoint, with no alternative route to their homes.
Israeli forces are indirectly forcing the citizens of the Old City to leave, aiming to build more settlements by making life harder for Palestinians.
Eid prayer at Al Aqsa mosque صلاة العيد في الأقصى

Eid prayer in the north of the Gaza Strip. 

صلاة العيد في شمال غزة

The Israeli occupation forces detain the Palestinian woman Hadeel Mardawi after raiding the village of Hablah, southern Qalqilia city. 

قوات الاحتلال تعتقل هديل مرداوي خلال اقتحام بلدة حبلة جنوب مدينة قلقيلية.

Pro Palestine protesters including the elderly and children were met with brutal police violence today, at the weekly demonstration in Manchester by the greater Manchester police for protesting against Israel’s genocide on Gaza.

The children of Gaza ahead of Eid .. civil defense forces and residents rescue and evacuate the bodies of children following an Israeli bombardment in Gaza city last night.

أطفال غزة عشية العيد ..

Palestinian children celebrate Eid in the yards of Al Aqsa hospital in Deir Al Balah, central Gaza.

فرحة الأطفال بالعيد في مستشفى الأقصى في دير البلح وسط القطاع
Continuous GENOCIDE.
Extreme heat poses a new danger to children made homeless.

The children of Gaza are trying to create joy amidst the destruction and death. 

أطفال غزة في محاولة لخلق الفرح في وسط الدمار والقصف

Khalaf Mreihel, specializing in premature infants, came as a volunteer with the Swedish Doctors delegation to Gaza City to try to help the health sector afflicted by the deliberate Israeli targeting of hospitals and doctors in the ongoing war of genocide against the Gazans.

The Palestinian Sultan Khatatbah who was shot dead by the occupation forces whilst they raided Beit Furik village east of Nablus. 

الشهيد سلطان عبدالرحمن خطاطبة، الذي ارتقى برصاص الاحتلال خلال المواجهات في بيت فوريك شرق نابلس.

A young man who wrote on the wall of his house, Eid Mubarak to you all : My family is still under the
rubble of the house, and this is the first Eid without them. I wanted to write next to their spirits and tell them that their Eid in paradise is more beautiful.

Faten Al Hinawi, mother of Amir Al Hinawi, shares the heartbreaking story of her son. Amir, who was born with deformities, often expresses his desire to have arms and legs like other children. Faten recounts the events of the 2018 war, during which their home near the border was bombarded with gases and white phosphorus, leading to Amir's condition while he was still a fetus. She explains the daily challenges they face, including the difficulty in maintaining a clean and germ-free environment for Amir, and their efforts to meet his needs.

Two young girls in North Gaza are interviewed about their experiences during the day leading to Eid Al Adha and the ongoing war. Hala and Yasemin share their feelings, expressing a longing to be happy, celebrate Eid, play, and eat meat like normal children. Hala explains how the war has affected her, describing the fear and disruption caused by fleeing their home and the subsequent bombing.
She mentions that they are now living at her aunt's place with no clothes, belongings, food, or drink.

Civil Defense crews deal with a child whose family was killed during the bombing of a house belonging to the Al-Jamasi family at dawn today, June 15, 2024. How can this child live after losing his mother and father?
Brutal air strike targeted Al-joumasi family, in Al-tuffah neighborhood eastern Gaza city last night. Resulting in babies killed and many injured.
Life in Gaza before and during the aggression.
A displaced person talks about his struggle to get water.

A Palestinian child: Mira Abu Khader (9 years old):
"We were living in fear. On our way here, we saw dead bodies all over the road. We walked long distances barefoot. The Israelis said the area was safe, but it's not true. Wherever we go, there are attacks"

Testimony of Reem Al-Assar, a young girl on a hospital bed with wounds covering her face, barely able to speak. Reem recounts her experience during the Nuseirat camp massacre on June 8th, when U.S. and Israeli Special Forces bombarded and raided the area, killing over 274 civilians and injuring at least 698 others, in an attempt to retrieve 4 hostages. She describes how, around 9:30 or 10 AM, explosions erupted everywhere, creating chaos and confusion.
As Reem and her family tried to flee to her grandfather's place, they encountered foggy streets and snipers. She narrowly escaped being shot when a bullet hit a piece of metal near her.
After that, quadcopters and Special Forces descended upon them, forcing her family to return home and huddle together in one room. The traumatic events left her struggling to recall what happened next, which led her to the hospital bed.
A Gazan girl talks about the way her father was killed and how her family and her were not able to bid him farewell.
Panic and fear among children due to the sounds of the continuous Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip.

The Israeli occupation forces open fire at a vehicle during a raid in Al Berih city. 

لحظة إطلاق جنود الاحتلال النار على مركبة في محيط مخيم الأمعري بمدينة البيرة.
Eid without Ola!

An old man from Jabalia is visibly  traumatized by the loss of 70 family members in Jabalia. He pleads for his message to be delivered to the world, recounting how his relatives were burned in what he describes as a complete extermination. The old man painfully details the horrific scene, explaining how he pulled their bodies from the rubble over two days.

‎رجل مسن من جباليا يبدو عليه الصدمة النفسية جراء فقدان 70 فرداً من عائلته في جباليا. يناشد إيصال رسالته إلى العالم، ويصف كيف تم حرق أقاربه فيما يسميه إبادة كاملة. يروي الرجل بألم المشهد المروع، موضحًا كيف قام بسحب جثثهم من تحت الأنقاض على مدى يومين.

A 12 year old child was found alone at the Netzerim checkpoint at midnight. The child, whose name and parents are unknown, was released by the occupation forces after midnight. Displaced people on the road saw him and immediately called an ambulance. Despite being asked for his name, he remained silent, unable to speak. The rescuers provided him with a pen and paper to express himself, and he drew a prison and a soldier hinting at what he had endured during his disappearance.

At least two Instagram accounts, claiming to be soldiers with the Givati brigade, shared what appeared to be drone footage showing buildings in the neighborhood in flames. An unidentified voice, presumably a soldier, is heard on the video saying they're setting out for "operation eighth night of Hannukah" to burn Shuja'iyya. "Let our enemies learn and be deterred...We will annihilate them to dust," the voice adds.

Pro Palestine student protesters occupied and barricaded themselves at the CSULA admin building in Los Angeles last night, to protest the genocide in Gaza that the university administration supports. The students used various tactics and left before the police arrived to make arrests. At what point will these universities divest from Israeli genocidal interests and listen to their students and put Palestinian life above such things as damaged property?

Dr. Israa Al-Naqeeb, 25 years old. Her mother, father, and 20 members of her family were martyred in an Israeli bombing that targeted her house. She survived under the rubble and after recovering, returned to her work at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital.

Despite the restrictions and barriers that separated the north and Gaza City from the center and south of the Gaza Strip, the people of the north will definitely say: Eid Mubarak to the people of the south and vice versa, especially since this is the second Eid we are experiencing in the shadow of war.
The roses of the people of the north have reached the people of the south.
Pray that the war ends soon and the people of the north get to meet the people in the south.

Two girls in Rafah are searching for sweets amidst the rubble of a recently bombed site. The girls explain how they gathered biscuits and chocolate from the debris. One child mentions that they were staying in a nearby camp when the bombardment happened, causing them to panic and flee, leaving their furniture behind. Despite finding some sweets, the children eventually decide to throw them away, lamenting that it would have been better if the sweets had been distributed before the bombing.

Essa Hijaze, at 10, has a responsibility to help his family and sells canned foods and spices in Northern Gaza markets, shedding light on starvation and soaring prices during the war. He contrasts today's scarcity-driven costs with prewar prices, emphasizing the harsh realities faced by families.

Do you understand the catastrophe that Gaza's children are enduring? Do you realize the extent of their deprivation, and how all their rights have been taken away in full view of the world without any concern for their protection?
Have you recognized the hypocrisy of international laws and organizations supposedly dedicated to children? Ask your child about their wish, and compare it to the wishes of a child from Gaza.

A near-death experience story of Palestinian Dr. Ali Al-Nueiri: Dr. Ali recounts a vision he had as his house was bombarded, where he saw a different sky filled with lights between sunrise and sunset. In this vision, he walked a path with his wife and son, who eventually had to leave him, as two figures in white told him it wasn't his time yet and that he needed to return to be tested further. Upon waking up, he found himself trapped under rubble, unable to breathe, until neighbors rescued him.His cousin later confirmed the deaths of his parents, brother, wife, and son. Overwhelmed with grief, Dr. Ali reflects on his deep bond with his wife during his road to recovery.
Displaced Palestinians wait for their share of food, as famine looms in northern Gaza.

Yasmin Mahmoud Labad, age 5 years old, born in January 2019, is suffering from leukemia (cancer) and currently has an enlarged liver and spleen along with weight loss. She needs treatment abroad, but due to the war and the closure of the border crossing, she is unable to receive treatment outside the country. Her condition was discovered during the war in May. However, the hospital's conditions do not allow for her to undergo surgery or proper diagnosis, and the hardships of displacement, among other factors, have had a significant impact on her condition.

In response to the numerous atrocities committed by the Israeli occupation, Lebanon continues to fire the most missiles since the 2006 war towards northern occupied Palestine with fires spreading. Israeli media reports that many planes and fire brigades are trying to put the fires out.

The house of our fellow paramedic Muhammad Azzam was targeted in Al-Zaytoon neighborhood.. resulting in 4 members of his family becoming martyrs, 4 injured, with two children missing under the rubble.
"Give me the key please, I want to keep it as a memory of my house" .. The little girl said to a journalist after her home was destroyed by the occupation forces in Kafr Dan village, west of Jenin.
The funeral of 6 Palestinians who were killed by the occupation forces in Kafr Dan village, west of Jenin.
A house belonging to the Al-Aila family in Al-Daraj neighborhood was targeted, there are 8 martyrs and 29 injured, most of them children and women.

Pro Palestine protesters took to the streets in New York City at various locations to demonstrate in response to the Nusairat massacre perpetrated by Israeli and American special forces in Gaza. The protest had an autonomous day of action organised by Within Our Lifetime, including a stop outside of the Zionist nova exhibition that serves Israeli propaganda. WOL has been banned from Instagram, you can follow them @wolpalestine on twitter and t.me/wolpalestine on telegram.
